item.title: Back-propagation from scratch (Python)
item.description: Let’s start from the Formula The first thing to implement an algorithm is to understand its mathematics, so I wrote it step by step here: During my implementation, I found that it’s super important to know the shape (or size) of each W, b, and error (delta) ! Otherwise, it would take you ages to debug and print every variable’s shape. Believe me, it sounds very troublesome to write down the size before implementing, but you will find it quite handy later;)
